definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Who cut the strings, so Duanchang impact of the song.
sentences.chinese: 是谁剪断了琴弦，弹着如此断肠的曲。

sentences.english: Bridges water side, leaving only a broken-hearted song in monopoly Wandering Road.
sentences.chinese: 小桥流水边，只剩断肠人在望断天涯路。

sentences.english: The sun was setting west, along with tears of someone at the edge of the world.
sentences.chinese: 夕阳西下，泪洒红尘里，人断肠，在天涯。

sentences.english: Heartbreak nowhere to turn, day in silence, only tears hovering.
sentences.chinese: 断肠无语问苍天，天不语，唯有泪徘徊。

sentences.english: I am too heartbroken to wipe tears out at all ?
sentences.chinese: “断肠人懒揩流泪眼”？若如此，可否译作。

sentences.english: Acacia, two kinds of melancholy, worth of charming, after all heartbroken.
sentences.chinese: 一曲相思，两种惆怅，万般妩媚，终究断肠。

sentences.english: Cicada without some trouble, people naturally worry in vain heartbroken.
sentences.chinese: 蝉声无一些烦恼，自是愁人枉断肠。

sentences.english: I hear you voice on the line.
sentences.chinese: 我听到你的声音，断肠崖在线。

sentences.english: People were sorry to hear his death, they call the plant as "Gelsemium elegans".
sentences.chinese: 人们非常难过，把这种草称为“断肠草”。

sentences.english: Is nothing but the word heartbroken.

definition: the cuckoo cries blood/fig. plaintive lament
lit. to feel as if one's intestines have been cut short/broken-hearted (idiom)
overwhelmed (with joy, sorrow etc)/to feel transported
